close_symbols: struct MHD_Connection (definition including fields: state, read_buffer, read_buffer_offset, rq.{field_lines.start, field_lines.size, req_target_len, http_mthd, method})
enum/defines for connection states: MHD_CONNECTION_REQ_LINE_RECEIVED, MHD_CONNECTION_HEADERS_RECEIVED
enum MHD_ProcRecvDataStage and values: MHD_PROC_RECV_HEADERS, MHD_PROC_RECV_BODY_CHUNKED
MHD_lookup_connection_value_n (function signature, return values and semantics; effect on host_field_name_value_len out parameter)
MHD_NO (symbolic return value used by MHD_lookup_connection_value_n)

threshold constants: MHD_MIN_REASONABLE_REQ_CHUNK_LINE_LENGTH_, MHD_MAX_REASONABLE_HEADERS_SIZE_, MHD_MAX_REASONABLE_REQ_TARGET_SIZE_, MHD_MIN_REASONABLE_HEADERS_SIZE_, MHD_MIN_REASONABLE_REQ_TARGET_SIZE_, MHD_MIN_REASONABLE_REQ_METHOD_SIZE_
HTTP status constants returned: MHD_HTTP_CONTENT_TOO_LARGE, MHD_HTTP_REQUEST_HEADER_FIELDS_TOO_LARGE, MHD_HTTP_NOT_IMPLEMENTED, MHD_HTTP_URI_TOO_LONG
standard strlen() semantics (or any project override)
explanation:
To decide whether any branch in get_no_space_err_status_code is unreachable you must know the concrete types, values and semantics of the symbols used in the branch conditions and the effect of assertions/callouts. For each listed symbol: 

- struct MHD_Connection (+ listed fields): the function reads many members (state, read_buffer, read_buffer_offset, rq.field_lines.start/size, rq.req_target_len, rq.http_mthd, rq.method). Knowing their types and any invariants is required to determine which if/else branches can ever be taken.

- MHD_CONNECTION_REQ_LINE_RECEIVED, MHD_CONNECTION_HEADERS_RECEIVED: these state constants are compared with c->state in several places; their ordering and numeric values determine reachability of branches guarded by those comparisons.

- enum MHD_ProcRecvDataStage and values MHD_PROC_RECV_HEADERS, MHD_PROC_RECV_BODY_CHUNKED: stage is compared against these constants; knowing their values/ordering is necessary to know which stage-specific branches are possible.

- mhd_assert: if this macro expands to an aborting check in production or to nothing in release, it changes whether code guarded only by assertions can be considered unreachable. You must know its behavior to decide if branches eliminated by asserted preconditions are actually unreachable.

- MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ and MHD_HTTP_HEADER_HOST: used to compute header_host_key_len/host_field_name_len and to detect Host: header. Their definitions determine the numeric lengths used in header comparisons.

- MHD_str_equal_caseless_bin_n_: defines the semantics of the host-name comparison (case-insensitive, length-limited); needed to decide whether is_host_header branch can be true for given inputs.

- MHD_lookup_connection_value_n and MHD_NO and MHD_HEADER_KIND: this function and its return semantics (and how it sets host_field_name_value_len) decide whether the path that computes host_field_line_size from lookup can be taken. Whether it can return found/not found affects reachability of that branch.

- MHD_HTTP_MTHD_OTHER and strlen() semantics: these determine when method_size is set to 0 vs strlen(c->rq.method) and therefore which comparisons involving method_size/uri_size/opt_headers_size can be true.

- Threshold constants (MHD_MIN_REASONABLE_REQ_CHUNK_LINE_LENGTH_, MHD_MAX_REASONABLE_HEADERS_SIZE_, MHD_MAX_REASONABLE_REQ_TARGET_SIZE_, MHD_MIN_REASONABLE_HEADERS_SIZE_, MHD_MIN_REASONABLE_REQ_TARGET_SIZE_, MHD_MIN_REASONABLE_REQ_METHOD_SIZE_): these numeric limits drive almost every later branching (returning different HTTP status codes). Their numeric values (and types) are required to prove or disprove reachability of the conditional blocks.

- HTTP status constants (MHD_HTTP_CONTENT_TOO_LARGE, MHD_HTTP_REQUEST_HEADER_FIELDS_TOO_LARGE, MHD_HTTP_NOT_IMPLEMENTED, MHD_HTTP_URI_TOO_LONG): while their numeric values are not necessary to detect unreachable code, including them clarifies which return branches are the outcomes and is helpful for analysis tools tracing flow-to-return.

- strlen() (or project-specific override): used to compute method_size when MHD_HTTP_MTHD_OTHER applies; its behavior and whether c->rq.method can be NULL (the code asserts non-NULL) affects reachability of branches that depend on method_size.

Collectively these symbols supply the numeric ranges, invariants and function behaviors needed to statically determine if any conditional or return in get_no_space_err_status_code is impossible (unreachable) under all valid inputs.
